thread.title: Barclays was visited by City watchdog nearly 200 times last year
thread.title_full: Barclays was visited by City watchdog nearly 200 times last year

title: Barclays was visited by City watchdog nearly 200 times last year
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Jul 21, 2015, 03:09 BST - UK Markets open in 4 hrs 51 mins Barclays was visited by City watchdog nearly 200 times last year By Andrew Trotman | Telegraph – 1 hour 59 minutes ago 280.85 +0.75 
Financial Conduct Authority figures show Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) was visited more than twice as often as any other bank 
The Financial Conduct Authority visited Barclays (Swiss: BARC.SW - news ) 186 times last year, more than twice as often as any other bank. 
The City watchdog met with HSBC, which was second on the list seen by Bloomberg , 85 times in 2014. 
Royal Bank of Scotland (LSE: RBS.L - news ) received the FCA 65 times, while Lloyds Banking Group was fourth with 58. 
Barclays' high number of visits could be due to its wide-reaching business, which spans high street lenders, investment banking and a credit card operation. 
The figures, which were released under a Freedom of Information request, cover the final year that the FCA was led by Martin Wheatley. 
Mr Wheatley was ousted by George Osborne last week after the Chancellor said a "different leadership" was needed to take the regulator forwards. 
“Britain needs a tough, strong financial conduct regulator. The government believes that different leadership is required to build on those foundations and take the organisation to the next stage of its development," Mr Osborne continued. 
Tracey McDermott, director of supervision, will take over as acting chief executive following a period when the FCA has cracked down on banks' wrongdoing during the financial crisis. 
Lenders have been forced to pay out billions of pounds in fines over scandals such as the manipulation of Libor and the mis-selling of payment protection insurance. 
International banks operating in the UK were also included in the FCA data. Citigroup (NYSE: C - news ) was visited 57 times by the watchdog, last year, Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS-PB - news ) 44 and Deutsche Bank (Xetra: 514000 - news ) 46.
